DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether nasal fentanyl is effective in the treatment of renal colic in adults in emergency department.
DOC.criteria: The patients were adults aged 18 to 65 years, presenting in ED with classical clinical symptoms of renal colic (sudden monolateral flank pain with inguinal irradiation) with a 10cm visual analog scale (VAS) greater than or equal to 7 Were analgesia within 6 hours of arrival Allergy to opiates and NSAIDs Opiates abuse, known or suspected abdominal aortic dissection or aneurism, Presence of peritonitis Hemodynamic instability Pregnancy, breastfeeding, anticoagulant therapy. Patients with known renal, pulmonary, cardiac or hepatic failure, as well as those with renal transplantation, were also excluded.
